case_vignette: A 46-year-old obese man comes to the emergency room because of paresthesias in his feet and a hypopigmented skin lesion on his knee that he first noticed 6 weeks ago. He has also had fever, fatigue, and malaise for the last week. He has a history of chronic autoimmune thyroiditis for which he takes levothyroxine. He immigrated from Indonesia 3 years ago to join his family in the United States. His temperature is 38.7°C (101.7°F) and blood pressure is 122/84 mm Hg. Physical exam shows a well-defined hypopigmented skin lesion approximately 3 cm in diameter over the anterior aspect of the right knee. The area has no hair growth and remains dry although he is diaphoretic. There is diminished sensation to light touch and pinprick in the skin lesion when compared to surrounding skin. There is reduced light touch sensation in the big toes bilaterally.
question: After obtaining a skin biopsy of the lesion to confirm the diagnosis, which  is the most appropriate initial pharmacotherapy?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been feeling a tingling sensation in my feet and I have a light-colored patch on my knee that I noticed about a month and a half ago. I've also been experiencing fever, tiredness, and just generally feeling unwell for the last week.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your feet or knee?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or trauma to my feet or knee.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments or animals?
I moved here from Indonesia 3 years ago, but I haven't mentioned any other recent travel or specific exposures.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, I haven't mentioned any recent changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent changes in your medications or supplements?
No, I just take levothyroxine for my thyroid condition, and there's been no change to that.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
No, there have been no recent changes in my family or medical history that I've mentioned.
Final Diagnosis: Lyme Disease.
